data.sentence: The word وَمَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
The word مِنْهُمْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.
data.sentence: The word الْأَمْوَالِ comes from the root م و ل and is associated with the meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.
The word مَنِ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to promise, give one's word, threaten, promise good, threaten (depending on context).. . Wa'ada act (pr.f 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promised.. Wa'adta (prf. 2nd. p. m. sing.): Thou promised.. Wa'adtu (prf. 1st. p. m. sing.): I promised.. Wa'aduu (prf. 3rd. p. plu.): They promised.. Wa'adna  (prf. 1st. p. m.): We promise.. Ya'idu (imp. 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promises, threatens.. 'Id (prt. m. sing.): promise.. Wu'ida (pp. 3rd. p. sing.): Has been promised.. Yuu'aduuna (pip. 3rd. p. plu.): They were threatened.. Tu'aduuna  (pip. 2nd. p. plu.) You are promised, are threatened.. Mau'uud (pic. pact. n. sing.): Promised.. Tuu'aduuna  (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. Mau'idan (n. place): Time; Place or time of the fulfilment of a prediction; Promise or warning; Appointment for meeting a promise.. Mii'aad  (for Miu'aad; n. place): Time; Time or place of the promise.
data.sentence: The word يَعِدُهُمُ comes from the root و ع د and is associated with the meanings: to promise, give one's word, threaten, promise good, threaten (depending on context).. . Yuu'aduuna (pip. 3rd. p. plu.): They were threatened.. Tu'aduuna  (pip. 2nd. p. plu.) You are promised, are threatened.. Mau'uud (pic. pact. n. sing.): Promised.. Tuu'aduuna  (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. Mau'idan (n. place): Time; Place or time of the fulfilment of a prediction; Promise or warning; Appointment for meeting a promise.. Mii'aad  (for Miu'aad; n. place): Time; Time or place of the promise.

data.meanings: deceived, beguiled, inexperienced or ignorant in affairs, act childish, exposed to perdition or destruction without knowing, gargled; whiteness, clearness of complexion; noble or eminent man, chief, lord, most precious and excellent; peril, danger, hazard; deficiency of, imperfect performance of; vain things, vanities
data.sentence: The word غُرُورًا comes from the root غ ر ر and is associated with the meanings: deceived, beguiled, inexperienced or ignorant in affairs, act childish, exposed to perdition or destruction without knowing, gargled; whiteness, clearness of complexion; noble or eminent man, chief, lord, most precious and excellent; peril, danger, hazard; deficiency of, imperfect performance of; vain things, vanities

data.meanings: to obey, permit/consent, obedience, to do voluntarily, do an act with effort. istaa'a - to be able, have power, be capable of.
data.sentence: The word اسْتَطَعْتَ comes from the root ط و ع and is associated with the meanings: to obey, permit/consent, obedience, to do voluntarily, do an act with effort. istaa'a - to be able, have power, be capable of.

data.meanings: to remove, provoke, expel, unsettle, be scared away from, turn away, startle. istafazza (vb. 10) - to excite, make active, deceive, unsettle, remove, expel, lead to destruction, make weak by humiliating, entail loss of right of citizenship.
data.sentence: The word وَاسْتَفْزِزْ comes from the root ف ز ز and is associated with the meanings: to remove, provoke, expel, unsettle, be scared away from, turn away, startle. istafazza (vb. 10) - to excite, make active, deceive, unsettle, remove, expel, lead to destruction, make weak by humiliating, entail loss of right of citizenship.

data.meanings: to emit a sound, utter a cry. saut (pl. aswat) - voice, sound.
data.sentence: The word بِصَوْتِكَ comes from the root ص و ت and is associated with the meanings: to emit a sound, utter a cry. saut (pl. aswat) - voice, sound.

data.meanings: To drive/bring/convey/transport, to draw/attract/procure a thing, gain or earn, seek after or seek to gain, to raise cries/shouts/noises, chide or urge on, to threaten, bring together/assemble/gather/collect, commit a crime or offence, to heal, to help/aid or assist, take or borrow, to seek or demand, to cover or clad oneself.
data.sentence: The word وَأَجْلِبْ comes from the root ج ل ب and is associated with the meanings: To drive/bring/convey/transport, to draw/attract/procure a thing, gain or earn, seek after or seek to gain, to raise cries/shouts/noises, chide or urge on, to threaten, bring together/assemble/gather/collect, commit a crime or offence, to heal, to help/aid or assist, take or borrow, to seek or demand, to cover or clad oneself.

data.meanings: To think or have an opinion of a thing, surmise or fancy a thing, limp or halt, slightly lame, image a thing (form an image) in the mind, perceive or discover, convey doubt or suspicion, to be cowardly or weak-hearted on the occassion of a fight [and thus do not act/proceed firmly or steadily], hold back from people or a party through cowardice, vie with/rival/imitate someone (do as he does) in pride and self-conceit, dubious/confused/vague, become abundant in plants or herbage (land), go on or away, act with a penetrative energy (being quick), behave proudly or haughtily, walk with pride or self-conceit, weak in heart and body, free from an attachment of love (having no spouse).
data.sentence: The word بِخَيْلِكَ comes from the root خ ي ل and is associated with the meanings: To think or have an opinion of a thing, surmise or fancy a thing, limp or halt, slightly lame, image a thing (form an image) in the mind, perceive or discover, convey doubt or suspicion, to be cowardly or weak-hearted on the occassion of a fight [and thus do not act/proceed firmly or steadily], hold back from people or a party through cowardice, vie with/rival/imitate someone (do as he does) in pride and self-conceit, dubious/confused/vague, become abundant in plants or herbage (land), go on or away, act with a penetrative energy (being quick), behave proudly or haughtily, walk with pride or self-conceit, weak in heart and body, free from an attachment of love (having no spouse).

data.meanings: to go on foot, urge with foot, walk, tie by the feet, let (a female) suckle her young, be curly (hair), set free with his mother. rajjala - to comfort anyone, comb the hair, grant a respite. tarajjala - to go down without rope. rijlatun - vigour in walking. rijlun - foot, soldiers, good walker, tramp. arajil - hunters, pedestrian. rajulun - male human being, man, a person with heir. rajilun - foot, footmen (slow walkers). rijlain - two feet. arjul (pl.) - feet.
data.sentence: The word وَرَجِلِكَ comes from the root ر ج ل and is associated with the meanings: to go on foot, urge with foot, walk, tie by the feet, let (a female) suckle her young, be curly (hair), set free with his mother. rajjala - to comfort anyone, comb the hair, grant a respite. tarajjala - to go down without rope. rijlatun - vigour in walking. rijlun - foot, soldiers, good walker, tramp. arajil - hunters, pedestrian. rajulun - male human being, man, a person with heir. rajilun - foot, footmen (slow walkers). rijlain - two feet. arjul (pl.) - feet.

data.meanings: to be a companion, be sharer/partner. shirkun - share, participation, polytheism, idolatry, making associate/partner with Allah. shariik (pl. shurakaa) - associate, partner, sharer. Nouns of the second declension when followed by the affixed pronouns take the three inflexions thus shurakaa, shurakaa'i, shurakaa'a. shaarak (vb. 3) - to share with. ashraka (vb. 4) - to make a sharer or associate, give companions (e.g. to God), be a polytheist or idolater. ashraktumuuni - you associated me as partner. mushrik - one who gives associate to God, polytheist. mushtarikun (vb. 8) - one who partakes or shares.
data.sentence: The word وَشَارِكْهُمْ comes from the root ش ر ك and is associated with the meanings: to be a companion, be sharer/partner. shirkun - share, participation, polytheism, idolatry, making associate/partner with Allah. shariik (pl. shurakaa) - associate, partner, sharer. Nouns of the second declension when followed by the affixed pronouns take the three inflexions thus shurakaa, shurakaa'i, shurakaa'a. shaarak (vb. 3) - to share with. ashraka (vb. 4) - to make a sharer or associate, give companions (e.g. to God), be a polytheist or idolater. ashraktumuuni - you associated me as partner. mushrik - one who gives associate to God, polytheist. mushtarikun (vb. 8) - one who partakes or shares.
The word وَالْأَوْلَادِ comes from the root و ل د and is associated with the meanings: to beget, give birth.
